intro: Inula campana, commonly known as the bellflower inula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, which bloom in late summer. Inula campana is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
